text: Denys Leontiyovych Maliuska (; born 19 November 1981) is a Ukrainian lawyer, businessman and politician. On 29 August 2019, he was appointed as the Minister of Justice of Ukraine. == Biography == Maliuska studied law at the Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv (2004). He also graduated from the University of London (2016). Master of Laws. From 2000 to 2010, Maliuska worked as a lawyer at the law firm Business Law. From 2010 to 2019, he served as a private sector consultant for the World Bank Group. Deputy Chairman of the Board of BRDO/World Bank Group. He was on a party list of the Servant of the People political party during the 2019 parliamentary elections, yet himself is not a registered member of the party (non-partisan, according to the Central Election Commission). Maliuska was elected to the Verkhovna Rada in 2019. He surrendered his deputy mandate upon his ministerial appointment on 29 August 2019. == See also == * Honcharuk Government * List of members of the parliament of Ukraine, 2019–24 == References == == External links == * Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:People from Dunaivtsi Category:Politicians from Kyiv Category:University of Kyiv, Law faculty alumni Category:Alumni of the University of London Category:21st-century Ukrainian lawyers Category:21st-century Ukrainian businesspeople Category:Ninth convocation members of the Verkhovna Rada Category:Justice ministers of Ukraine Category:Servant of the People (political party) politicians Category:21st-century Ukrainian politicians
title: Denys Maliuska
